Reproducibility in Science

A Guide to enhancing reproducibility in scientific results and writing

ABOUT

In every field of science, scientists are increasingly using electronic tools, from collecting their data to publishing their results. With this increase in computational tools comes the advantage of reproducibility at an extent not previously possible. However, as computational tools become more complex and pervasive, ensuring the reproducibility of results can be more challenging, owing to the greater variety of ways of approaching analyses and incompatibility of data structures and file types. This is a guide to make it easier for you to conduct and communicate scientific research by using tools that promote reproducibility.

As technology evolves, so do best practices in using these technologies. If you have already written something that you believe fits well here, consider submitting to part of a section or creating entirely an new section for your work. Contributions to the guide are highly encouraged, and are straight-forward to make using Github.
